articles.headline: Pension Deal Edges Detroit a Step Closer to Recovery
articles.snippet: In its rush to exit bankruptcy, the city reached an agreement that would prevent cuts to pensions of retired police officers and firefighters.
articles.abstract: In its rush to exit bankruptcy, the city reached an agreement that would prevent cuts to pensions of retired police officers and firefighters.
articles.lead_paragraph: Detroit’s pension boards and a retirees’ group say they have reached tentative agreements with the city that could serve as a breakthrough in its quest to settle with its major creditors and propel itself out of bankruptcy before the end of the year.

articles.headline: Yahoo Profit Is a Footnote to Alibaba’s Huge Gains
articles.snippet: Yahoo’s shareholders are far more excited about what the company owns — namely, 24 percent of Alibaba — than anything the company runs.
articles.abstract: Yahoo’s shareholders are far more excited about what the company owns — namely, 24 percent of Alibaba — than anything the company runs.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Investors were already salivating over the initial stock offering of Alibaba Group, the giant Chinese e-commerce company. On Tuesday, they got a glimpse of Alibaba’s tremendous growth that is sure to whet their appetite even more.

articles.headline: Tech Leaps, Job Losses and Rising Inequality
articles.snippet: For 50 years, economic consensus has held that new machines lift demand for skilled workers. But what if technology has become a substitute for labor?
articles.abstract: For 50 years, economic consensus has held that new machines lift demand for skilled workers. But what if technology has become a substitute for labor?
articles.lead_paragraph: It’s hard to overstate the excitement of tech people about what is on the verge of happening to the practice of medicine.

articles.headline: Early Data in E-Cigarette Study May Raise Safety Concerns
articles.snippet: The study, still in a preliminary stage, found that lung cells exposed to e-cigarette vapor showed cancerous reactions similar to cells exposed to tobacco smoke.
articles.abstract: The study, still in a preliminary stage, found that lung cells exposed to e-cigarette vapor showed cancerous reactions similar to cells exposed to tobacco smoke.
articles.lead_paragraph: A laboratory study presented early this year reported that the nicotine-laced vapor generated by an electronic cigarette promoted the development of cancer in certain types of human cells much in the same way that tobacco smoke does.

articles.headline: Texas Twins Campaign, but They Aren’t Sure for What
articles.snippet: While Mayor Julián Castro of San Antonio and Representative Joaquin Castro have projected a fresh Latino face for the Democratic Party, some are concerned they are too politically cautious.
articles.abstract: While Mayor Julián Castro of San Antonio and Representative Joaquin Castro have projected a fresh Latino face for the Democratic Party, some are concerned they are too politically cautious.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN ANTONIO, Tex. — Mayor Julián Castro of San Antonio faced off in a televised debate on Tuesday against a Republican candidate for Texas lieutenant governor, even though Mr. Castro, officially anyway, is not running for anything at all.

articles.headline: Russia Is Quick to Bend Truth About Ukraine
articles.snippet: Misinformation, exaggerations, conspiracy theories, overheated rhetoric and outright lies about the political crisis in Ukraine have emanated from the highest echelons of the Kremlin.
articles.abstract: Misinformation, exaggerations, conspiracy theories, overheated rhetoric and outright lies about the political crisis in Ukraine have emanated from the highest echelons of the Kremlin.
articles.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW — The Facebook post on Tuesday morning by Prime Minister Dmitri A. Medvedev of Russia was bleak and full of dread.

articles.headline: Despite Rise in Spills, Hazardous Cargo Rides Rails in Secret
articles.snippet: As alarmed communities complain about dangerous cargo running on the tracks through their towns, new rules for handling such cargo are set to take effect.
articles.abstract: As alarmed communities complain about dangerous cargo running on the tracks through their towns, new rules for handling such cargo are set to take effect.
articles.lead_paragraph: Jodi Ross, town manager in Westford, Mass., did not expect she would be threatened with arrest after she and her fire chief went onto the railroad tracks to find out why a train carrying liquid petroleum gas derailed on a bridge in February.

articles.headline: Brazil’s Star, Petrobras, Is Hobbled by Scandal and Stagnation
articles.snippet: Petrobras has recently come to symbolize disarray in Brazil’s sluggish economy and the reassessment of growth prospects in emerging markets.
articles.abstract: Petrobras has recently come to symbolize disarray in Brazil’s sluggish economy and the reassessment of growth prospects in emerging markets.
articles.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO — No company has embodied Brazil’s rise like the oil giant Petrobras.
articles.byline: By Simon Romero and Landon Thomas Jr

articles.headline: As Credit Dries Up, Smaller Companies in China Feel the Pinch
articles.snippet: Exorbitant interest rates and a scarcity of loans have turned financing into a challenge for those without the political connections to borrow at regulated rates.
articles.abstract: Exorbitant interest rates and a scarcity of loans have turned financing into a challenge for those without the political connections to borrow at regulated rates.
articles.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — Hunan Xinwei Bags Company, a manufacturer of knapsacks and handbags, is struggling to survive. The Chinese economy is slowing. Wages are rising amid a shortage of blue-collar workers. And competition from countries like Vietnam is growing.

articles.headline: Ukraine Push Against Rebels Grinds to Halt
articles.snippet: Pro-Russian militias commandeered vehicles from the Ukrainian Army as a military operation by the Kiev government in the eastern part of the nation fell apart.
articles.abstract: Pro-Russian militias commandeered vehicles from the Ukrainian Army as a military operation by the Kiev government in the eastern part of the nation fell apart.
articles.lead_paragraph: SLOVYANSK, Ukraine — A military operation that the Ukrainian government said would confront pro-Russian militants in the east of the country unraveled in disarray on Wednesday with the entire contingent of 21 armored vehicles that had separated into two columns surrendering or pulling back before nightfall. It was a glaring humiliation for the new government in Kiev.

articles.headline: The Future of Facebook May Not Say ‘Facebook’
articles.snippet: The company’s strategy includes unbundling its mammoth social network into discrete and nimble components.
articles.abstract: The company’s strategy includes unbundling its mammoth social network into discrete and nimble components.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the two years since its rocky initial public offering, Facebook has become a strong business that regularly releases financial results that set investors’ hearts aflutter. Despite every hipster prediction otherwise, the company’s user base keeps growing, and nearly a fifth of the time that Americans spend on their smartphones is spent on Facebook. That surpasses the amount of time we spend on any other single service by a wide margin — and beats just about anything else we do on our phones, or perhaps in our lives, period.

articles.headline: Hanging a Shingle in Detroit
articles.snippet: An urban area filled with empty buildings and an underused labor force offers some powerful advantages but it also has its challenges.
articles.abstract: An urban area filled with empty buildings and an underused labor force offers some powerful advantages but it also has its challenges.
articles.lead_paragraph: DETROIT — Ask business owners what it is like to operate in Detroit and you will hear comparisons to the Wild West or a third-world country. They often mean it as a compliment.
